t: Now*p there was a man from the mountains of Ephraim, whose name was*i Micah.

And he said to his mother, “The eleven hundred shekels*i of silver that were taken from you, and on which you put a curse, even saying it in my ears—here is*i the silver with me; I took it.” And*p his mother said, “May*i you*i be*i blessed by the Lord,*s my son!”

So when he had returned the eleven hundred shekels*i of silver to his mother, his mother said, “I had wholly dedicated the silver from my hand to the Lord*s for my son, to make a carved image and a molded image; now therefore, I will return it to you.”

Thus he returned the silver to his mother. Then his mother took two hundred shekels*i of silver and gave them to the silversmith, and he made it into a carved image and a molded image; and they were in the house of Micah.
The*p man Micah had a shrine, and made an ephod and household idols; and he consecrated one of his sons, who became his priest.
In those days there*i was*i no king in Israel; everyone did what*i was*i right in his own eyes.
Now*p there was a young man from Bethlehem in Judah, of the family of Judah; he was*i a Levite, and was staying there.
The man departed from the city of Bethlehem in Judah to stay wherever he could find a*i place.*i Then he came to the mountains of Ephraim, to the house of Micah, as he journeyed.
And Micah said to him, “Where do you come from?” So*p he said to him, “I am*i a Levite from Bethlehem in Judah, and I am on my way to find a*i place*i to stay.”
Micah*p said to him, “Dwell with me, and be a father and a priest to me, and I will give you ten shekels*i of silver per year, a suit of clothes, and your sustenance.” So the Levite went in.
Then the Levite was content to dwell with the man; and the young man became like one of his sons to him.
So Micah consecrated the Levite, and the young man became his priest, and lived in the house of Micah.
Then Micah said, “Now I know that the Lord*s will be good to me, since I have a Levite as priest!”
